messages.message:
`To try AI Hub for free, please visit our desktop site. Mobile support coming soon!`

Saw this message upon opening aihub on mobile. I found it confusing. Is there a separate desktop site?! :slightly_smiling_face:

Can we update this message to indicate that this site should be opened using a desktop/laptop? As an example: `To try AI Hub for free, please visit this site on your desktop or laptop. Mobile support is coming soon!`

BTW: great to see this mobile version. Every feature is nicely disabled!

Thanks for the feedback! We went over this copy a lot, @Ashish.

Would love to hear if others also find it confusing. @jean @Kerry

I showed this to a few non-technical people and they found it confusing too. I wonder if we could make it more clear by saying something link `To try AI Hub for free, please visit aihub.instabase.com (http://aihub.instabase.com) on your desktop. Mobile support coming soon!`

This will just make it clear what the desktop site is

Also separately, a few people (sample size = 2) wanted to click the `converse, build, and discover more apps sections` . They thought they were clickable buttons v/s marketing copy. I wonder if we will see this more broadly and need to reconsider the design
Interesting. Design team focused on making these icons look static. Seems we may have to go further! @alagu
thanks for the feedback. let's create a ticket of this, and we can do some changes in the next iteration.
The mobile experience is quite important - 1/3rd of our traffic has been on mobile today consistently.
